H0.text: Infant is a baby during the first year after birth.

H1.text: Toddler is a baby during the first year after birth.

H2.text: Newborn is a baby during the first year after birth.

H3.text: Fetus is the term used to describe a baby during the first year after birth.

A4.text: The term infant is typically applied to very young children under one year of age; however, definitions may vary and may include children up to two years of age.

A5.text: A newborn is, in colloquial use, a baby who is only hours, days, or weeks old.

A6.text: In medical contexts, a newborn or neonate is an infant in the first 28 days after birth.

A7.text: Before birth, the offspring is called a fetus.
